Several years back I was a loyal buyer of Riggs rip stop jeans. Suddenly, the rip stop ability disappeared while the look of the material remained the same. Apparently, the name Wrangler causes jeans to weaken and fail prematurely and I say that because that is exactly when the problems started.

I have ordered 6 pairs of these as they are comfortable, fit well, and i like all the pockets. But every single pair has developed a hole along the left side of the zipper near the bottom. The hole soon splits into a huge tear down the left pant leg despite my attempts to patch and sew them up. There are very few pants made in my size (48X36) so i was loyal to these until the last 6 par have all had the same issue. Now i am spending hours looking for a new brand in the size i need that can take the work i do. As a work pant these are very inadequate.
Ordered by mistake and are the best pants for price I've owned.

I have been wearing Riggs wear since they started selling them because they had a larger thigh than anything else on the market. That was when they were made in the USA. When they moved production to Mexico the sizes changed, but they still fit. Now that production has been moved to El Salvador and Honduras the sizes have changed again and now the thigh and waist are measurably smaller than in the past.
Fit as they should. Size is right on.
